Take Metro-North and Be a Part of Walkway’s 3rd Annual World Record Event!

Take Metro-North to Walkway Over the Hudson State Historic Park and join in to break the record for the World's Longest Handshake Relay on Sunday, June 1! In celebration of Walkway’s commitment to bridging communities they are bringing together people from throughout the Hudson Valley and beyond to break yet another World Record! Take Metro-North's Hudson Line to Poughkeepsie! The 7:43 AM train from Grand Central Terminal arrives in Poughkeepsie at 9:36 AM. Hourly service for return trips. Go to http://bit.ly/1arccwk for schedule and fare information. See http://bit.ly/1tuIyja for event info.

On Memorial Day Weekend, the “unofficial" start of summer, Metro-North’s West-of-Hudson service will include early getaway service on Friday, along with several schedule changes. Regular weekend service will operate on Saturday, May 24 and Sunday, May 25. On Memorial Day, Monday, May 26, weekend service will be in effect on both lines, with an extra afternoon train from Port Jervis. See full details at http://bit.ly/1giWlZu

Memorial Day Holiday Weekend Service, Friday, May 23 - Monday, May 26

Metro-North's Memorial Day Holiday Weekend service helps you get a jump on the unofficial start of summer with plenty of extra early getaway service on Friday, May 23. On Saturday, May 24, and Sunday, May 25, regular weekend service will operate. On Memorial Day (Monday, May 26), trains will operate on a Sunday schedule with one extra inbound (to Grand Central) train departing New Haven at 7:40 PM and making select express stops. We’ll also operate one extra outbound express train (to New Haven) departing Grand Central at 11:13 PM and making select express stops. See details at http://bit.ly/RROkPV

Metro-North Announces Sweeping Series of Safety Reforms

Metro-North Railroad has announced details on the sweeping series of reforms underway to better ensure the safety of its customers and employees. The reforms address factors identified during several serious safety incidents over the last year, as well as issues identified by an in-depth Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) review of its operating practices. See details at http://bit.ly/1lvMM5R

Metro-North Anticipates 5-10 minute delays on the New Haven Line Until further notice due to Saturd

Metro-North expects 5-10 minute delays on the New Haven Line until further notice due to a fire that destroyed a critical switching control house near Cos Cob on Saturday, limiting the railroad to two of four tracks in the peak direction through a nine-mile area. The fire has also resulted in eliminating the ability of the railroad to operate trains around problems in this area. Crews are currently working around the clock to make repairs. See http://bit.ly/1nDxEqt for details. We regret any inconvenience you may experience as a result of this incident.

Metro-North’s Train Time App, website information, and station LCD monitors rely on the signal system to track the status of trains and provide train information. Due to the damage to the control house that affects the signal system between Stamford and Port Chester, there will be inaccurate reporting on the status of trains while going through this section of the New Haven Line. Once trains have cleared the section, their current status will be updated to provide real-time train information.
Metro-North Anticipates 5-10 minute delays on the New Haven Line Until further notice due to Saturd

Metro-North expects 5-10 minute delays on the New Haven Line until further notice due to a fire that destroyed a critical switching control house near Cos Cob on Saturday, limiting the railroad to two of four tracks in the peak direction through a nine-mile area. The fire has also resulted in eliminating the ability of the railroad to operate trains around problems in this area. Crews are currently working around the clock to make repairs. See http://bit.ly/1nDxEqt for details. We regret any inconvenience you may experience as a result of this incident.
New Haven Line westbound service has resumed between Old Greenwich and Cos Cob. We apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced as result of this incident.

Metro-North Anticipates 5-10 minute delays on the New Haven Line Until further notice due to Saturd

Metro-North expects 5-10 minute delays on the New Haven Line until further notice due to a fire that destroyed a critical switching control house near Cos Cob on Saturday, limiting the railroad to two of four tracks in the peak direction through a nine-mile area. The fire has also resulted in eliminating the ability of the railroad to operate trains around problems in this area. Crews are currently working around the clock to make repairs. See http://bit.ly/1nDxEqt for details. We regret any inconvenience you may experience as a result of this incident.

To Hudson Line Customers Traveling to/from Riverdale, Ludlow, Glenwood & Greystone Stations

To Hudson Line Customers Traveling to/from Riverdale, Ludlow, Glenwood & Greystone Stations Because of ongoing track work as well as structural repairs and stabilization work by the building owner in the vicinity of the mudslide near Glenwood Station, service changes will be in effect until further notice at the Hudson Line Stations in the affected area. AM Peak on Friday, May 2: All inbound local trains will arrive on the regular inbound (to New York) platform. Outbound customers at these stations must enter/exit from head car of the train and use bridgeplates to access the station platform. For more details, visit http://bit.ly/SeCMH3

To Hudson Line Customers Traveling to/from Riverdale, Ludlow, Glenwood & Greystone Stations

Because of ongoing track work as well as structural repairs and stabilization work by the building owner in the vicinity of the mudslide near Glenwood Station, service changes will be in effect until further notice at the Hudson Line Stations in the affected area. Tonight (Thursday, May 1): Until 8 PM, trains will stop at the opposite side platforms at Riverdale, Ludlow, Glenwood and Greystone Stations. Outbound locals will arrive on the regular inbound platform. Inbound trains will arrive on the outbound side; customers must enter/exit from the head car, using bridgeplates to the station platform. From 8 PM-Midnight, all outbound local trains will arrive on the inbound (to New York) platform. Inbound, bus service will be in effect between Yonkers Station and Riverdale, Ludlow, Glenwood & Greystone Stations.
